comment.text: No issues noted in everyday use.

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:
Firefox crashes when i Tryed  to open webradio playlistfiles dirrectly
Only save and open manually in VLC will work

Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable):42.0


How reproducible:everyteime


Steps to Reproduce:
1.open Firefox 42
2.try to opnen a Webradiostream directly from Fireox e.g with vlx

Actual results:
firefox crashes

Expected results:
Firefox shuld open vlc and ply the stream

Can you attach a backtrace please? How to is here:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Debugging_guidelines_for_Mozilla_products

uff, it looks like your Firefox doesn't even start and fails to detect DISPLAY. Do you run it from terminal emulator, like gnome-terminal? You should use that. Which is your DISPLAY env value? (put $set | grep "DISPLAY" on terminal)

i start Firefox not in the terminal.
But your command put $set | grep "DISPLAY" end in Bash command not found

aah i See wat´ s wrong

set | grep "DISPLAY"
DISPLAY=:0
WAYLAND_DISPLAY=wayland-0
_=DISPLAY
well, your display is correct, please try catch the ff crash in the same window. Thanks.
yes i can do this but i See only the messages "firefox has crashed

I see such crash on Rawhide - it comes from glibc. Unfortunately I don't have any F23 system handy.

Anyway, can you please attach an info from "about:support" page? Use the "Copy text to clipboard" button please.

Also, can you please post crash signatures from "about:crashes" page?

Thanks!

It may be a side effect of https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1129873 I guess it needs update for F23.
and what or can i do to fix the problem or mus i wait for any update ???
There's no fix available we need to investigate what's wrong here.

Hm, I can't reproduce any more on rawhide (gtk3-3.19.7). I'm also unable to reproduce on F22 (gtk3-3.16.7), so looks like F23 issue only (gtk3-3.18.x).

We may provide a workaround just for F23.
The problem here is that gtk_widget_destroy() causes the crash. We may use gtk_widget_hide() as a workaround for F23 and let the parent destroy GtkApp widget.
Ustream bug: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1244305
*** Bug 1302044 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
@ Martin Stransky can you tll me how i can use the workaround, witch file must be edited ?

> must be edited ?

A new packages are in koji (44.0.1) which should workaround that.

and now the next problem:
I´ ve testet the Firefox 44.0.5 from the testing repo the problem was not fixed when you select vlc to listen the webradiostream. 

So i think in firefox 44.0.1 the same problem

Bug #1302044 fixed with 44.0.1 from koji.

@Matthias31 Note the "-" in 44.0.5 OR 44.0-5, there is a big difference!

Here is the koji build, the one you could not find:
http://koji.fedoraproject.org/koji/buildinfo?buildID=733555

fact is firefox 44.0.1 fix the Problem of applicationchoser, there was no crashes after the install.

it is possible to push the ff relase in the repo´ s fram f23?
I am sure it will be available as an update once the developers make sure nothing else major breaks because of changes.
We'll ship 44.0.1 when it's released by Mozilla. The recent builds we have in Koji miss some fixes and are not ready yet.

Hello @Matthias31, How are you?

I've tested the package firefox-44.0.2-3.fc22 in a fedora 22, to open a *.pls link using firefox and it has opened correctly another via application (e.g., vlc). Could you test again in this version? are there another step to reproduce this bug?

Thank you.
firefox-44.0.2-3.fc22 has been pushed to the Fedora 22 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

Since upstream bug https://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=762994 has been fixed in all supported Fedora versions (F24: glib 2.48.1 and 2.48.2; F25: glib since its first pre-release version), how about dropping this patch?
Yes, that possible, thanks.

comments.text: This update has been submitted for testing by stransky.
No issues noted in everyday use.
This update has been pushed to testing.
This update has been submitted for stable by bodhi.
This update has been pushed to stable.

notes:
- Updated to new upstream (44.0.1)

- Fixed AppChooser dialog crashes
